title: Manchin and Murkowski signal optimism on Electoral Count Act reform
description: Democratic Sen. Joe Manchin and Republican Sen. Lisa Murkowski on Sunday signaled optimism about their work to reform the Electoral Count Act, with Manchin going so far as to say it will "absolutely" pass, during a rare bipartisan interview on CNN.

title: Senegal beats Egypt to win Africa Cup of Nations trophy
description: Senegal defeated Egypt in the Africa Cup of Nations championship match on Sunday, winning the continental championship for the first time on penalty kicks at Olembe Stadium in Yaoundé, Cameroon.

title: Sadio Mane penalty secures African Cup of Nations final victory for Senegal
description: Handed a chance of redemption, Senegal forward Sadio Mane didn't pass up the opportunity to make history for his country.

title: 18 people rescued from ice floe
description: Eighteen people were rescued from an ice floe that separated from land near Catawba Island in Lake Erie, the US Coast Guard said Sunday.

title: See dramatic moment Maryland police corporal saves kid from oncoming car
description: Police corporal Annette Goodyear pushed a student out of the way in the nick of time after a car failed to stop at a school crossing. Local officials have praised her bravery.

title: India honors singer Lata Mangeshkar at state funeral, dead at 92
description: Lata Mangeshkar, the "nightingale of India" who gave her voice to Indian movies for more than 70 years, died Sunday in Mumbai, according to Prime Minister Narendra Modi and local media reports. She was 92.

title: Crowds of demonstrators join rallies across Canada as Covid-19 trucker protests spread
description: From the western province of Alberta, moving east to Quebec City, and in cities and towns in between, thousands of Canadians have hit the streets in trucks, tractors, cars and on foot to protest the nation's Covid-19 restrictions.

title: Analysis: Why GOP increasingly casts White people as racism's victims
description: Early barbs for President Joe Biden's Supreme Court selection process have helped crystallize a rising Republican line of attack against Democrats.

title: Video shows church congregation burning popular books
description: Pastor Greg Locke live streamed the book burning event on Facebook after encouraging his congregation to burn their "accursed items," including titles from the 'Harry Potter' and 'Twilight' series.

title: Families turn to these YouTube divers to find lost loved ones
description: Jared Leisek started "Adventures with Purpose" as a mission to clean up trash in lakes and rivers. 19 cold cases later, his team have found countless clues hidden beneath the water's surface, and become a lifeline for families desperate for answers.

title: How war has devastated Ukraine's coal industry
description: Ukraine was once Europe's third-largest coal producer. But production has dropped dramatically since 2014, when fighting broke out with pro-Russian separatists in the eastern Donbas region.

title: Joe Biden should be thankful he's polling better than Boris Johnson
description: President Joe Biden has the worst approval rating after one year in office of nearly every elected president, except for former President Donald Trump. But a look across the Atlantic Ocean shows that things can always be worse for Biden.

title: Joe Rogan apologizes for using racial slurs
description: Joe Rogan issued an apology on Instagram Saturday after a compilation of the podcaster frequently using the n-word on his podcast spread widely on social media.

title: New satellite images show advanced Russian military deployments in Belarus
description: New satellite images released by a US-based technology company appear to show that Russia's military has advanced deployments at several locations in Belarus, a move likely to concern Ukraine and NATO amid fears that the Kremlin is planning an incursion into Ukrainian territory.

title: Eight killed in two days after third deadly avalanche hits Austria
description: One person was killed and four others injured in an avalanche in western Austria on Saturday, police said, a day after two other avalanches killed seven skiers as heavy snowfall followed by warmer weather made for unusually dangerous conditions.

title: Harold Varner III sinks monster eagle putt on final hole to win the 2022 Saudi International
description: Harold Varner III drained a huge eagle putt on the 18th hole of the final round to snatch victory at the 2022 Saudi International on Sunday.

title: YouTube divers crack a missing person cold case
description:
• A Florida man took his grandson magnet fishing. Police are now investigating what they reeled in
• A man is accused of breaking into Michael Bloomberg's ranch and kidnapping an employee

title: Top 15 athletes to watch at Winter Games
Camilla will be Queen: Elizabeth II uses Platinum Jubilee message to elevate Charles' second wife
New Belgian passports celebrate country's comic strip history
description: Most passports tend to be relatively uniform in design. They're often burgundy, black, or blue in color and they might encompass a small version of the symbol of a nation. But that won't be the case for Belgians come February 7 -- the country will now issue passports defined by images of its comic strip heroes, from Tintin to the Smurfs.

title: US-born figure skater Zhu Yi under attack after fall on Olympic debut for China
description: Making her Olympic debut for Team China, California-born figure skater Zhu Yi was eager to prove herself to the Chinese public.

title: Prince Charles leads tributes to his mother, the Queen, on her Platinum Jubilee
Scientists record orcas hunting and killing an adult blue whale for the first time
description: A pack of orcas hunting and killing an adult blue whale has been recorded for the first time, scientists say.

title: Prince Andrew to give statement under oath
description: Britain's Prince Andrew has agreed to give a statement under oath on March 10 in the UK as part of the civil case against him, a source close to the Duke of York told CNN on Saturday.

title: Death of ISIS chief raises more questions than it answers
description: The so-called caliphate has lost its leader again. On the surface, the US commando raid in Syria that left ISIS chief Abu Ibrahim al-Hashimi al-Qurayshi dead may look like a game-changer, but experts warn the resurgence of the group is likely to press on undeterred.

title: Colombia made peace with guerrillas years ago. Why is violence surging again?
description: This year kicked off with a violent start on the Colombia-Venezuela border, where dissident militant factions have been competing for territorial control of lucrative drug routes that connect the South American country to the US and Europe. At least 23 people were killed in violent clashes at the start of the year, followed by a deadly car bomb and the murder of a local community leader and his wife.

title: This is the space graveyard where the International Space Station will be buried
description: Three thousand miles off the coast of New Zealand and 2,000 miles north of Antarctica, Point Nemo is so far from land that the closest humans are often the astronauts on board the International Space Station -- that orbits 227 nautical miles above Earth.

title: Author calls the Queen's announcement about Camilla a 'masterstroke'
description: Britain's Queen Elizabeth II has used the historic milestone of her Platinum Jubilee to redefine the future of the monarchy, calling for the Duchess of Cornwall to be known as Queen Camilla when Charles becomes King.

title: The best photos from the Olympics
description: Let the Games begin.

title: US gold medal hopeful cleared to compete after bout with Covid-19
description:
• Norway off to golden start; China claims first gold
• Shaun White: 'This will be my last Olympics'

title: Why China won't put its economy on the line to rescue Putin
description: Russia has one obvious ally to turn to as geopolitical sparks fly with the West over Ukraine.
